imdb.title: Concrete Revolutio: Chôjin gensô
imdb.plot: In an alternate 1960s history where extraterrestrial, supernatural and paranormal beings reside in Japan, a special bureau works to maintain peace and order.

episodes.title: The Superhumans of November
episodes.plot: Raito, now a member of the Superhuman Bureau, begins to question his way of life. One day, he meets Washizu, a similarly built android sheriff from outer space, without the questions plaguing Raito's mechanical mind.

episodes.title: Those That Reach for Space
episodes.plot: A series of murders takes place. All of the victims were visitors from outer space, disguised as humans. The prime suspect is Aki, who used to be part of the Angel Stars idol group.

episodes.title: I Call Out Your Name in the Town Where Flowers Bloom
episodes.plot: The city of Sapporo is excited about the upcoming international winter sports event. The Japanese superhuman ski jumping athletes are expected to win medals, but dark clouds gather over the venue.

episodes.title: Devila and Devilo
episodes.plot: The human race begins developing the region beneath the Earth's surface. However, the area is inhabited by powerful monsters, led by Queen Devila and her little brother Devilo.

episodes.title: Seitaka Awadachi Plant
episodes.plot: The Canada Goldenrod, a non-native plant, rapidly grows in many areas all over Japan. Wakamura seems to be allergic to the pollen, but he soon finds out there is more to this plant than the sneezing.

episodes.title: Iron Mask Has Arrived
episodes.plot: A superhuman is discovered, still alive, in a block of ice. She is Koma, the legendary Iron Mask Fencer from the Sengoku period of Japan.

episodes.title: The Endless Battle
episodes.plot: The Superhuman Bureau is tasked with the mission to find a soldier who escaped from a US army base. Jiro does not agree to the inhumane practice of military superhuman use, and teams up with Raito to try and return Jonathan to his home.

episodes.title: The Iron Ogre
episodes.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

episodes.title: The Era of Giant Gods
episodes.plot: A new movie is released in Japan, instantly filling theaters. The movie stars lookalikes of the Superhuman Bureau, and claims to reveal a hidden truth.

episodes.title: Beast and Maiden
episodes.plot: The Superhuman Bureau is officially disbanded, and its former members either go into hiding or join the government. Then, Master Ultima hosts the Okinawa Superhuman Expo, a major event showcasing the benefits that superhumans possess.

episodes.title: Can You Still Sing?
episodes.plot: Superhumans are now divided into two groups, and every superhuman is forced to choose a side. Jiro, as a beast, leads the war against humans, and now Kikko must face him - all according to Satomi's plan.

episodes.title: The Tokyo Witch
episodes.plot: Jiro Hitoyoshi, member of the Superhuman Bureau, goes to a local diner in order to recruit Kikko Hoshino, a witch working as a waitress. Whilst that occurs, two superhumans are fighting: Grosse Augen and an "S" Planetarian, thus it is Jiro's job to interfere.

episodes.title: Inside the 'Black Smog
episodes.plot: The Superhuman Bureau teams up with Fuurota, a young, mischievous ghost in order to stop the "Black Fog", a catastrophic event that was caused by the same insect Fuurota set free.

episodes.title: People with a Steel Frame
episodes.plot: Raito Shiba, a cyborg detective who investigates superhumans, looks into cases of serial bombings. While investigating, he finds a girl named Mieko, and has to deal with these newfound feelings.

episodes.title: Japan Beast History, Part 1
episodes.plot: Beasts have started to appear all across Japan. Jiro investigates a company that is starting a radio for beasts. There he meets a beast who is actually kind. But there's more to this beast than at first glance.

episodes.title: Japan Beast History, Part 2
episodes.plot: When the U.S. weaponize space beasts, other nations begin to do the same. Can they manage to control these beasts and keep them peaceful?

episodes.title: They Are Always Laughing
episodes.plot: The band "The Mountain Horses" come to Japan, and with them, bring supernatural powers. Their music begins to have a special effect on Japan's youth. Is the band responsible for the rise in superhuman powers?

episodes.title: Go Beyond the Sky and Stars
episodes.plot: Earth-chan is famous for her heroism, automatically appearing whenever anyone is need. She is faced with a major conflict when Judas, member of a robbery group, has a change of heart. Can Judas be trusted?

episodes.title: Nobody Knows About the Rainbow Knight
episodes.plot: Rainbow Knight, a famous superhuman and hero of justice, is framed of committing a kidnapping. Jiro was saved by Rainbow Knight as a kid, and holds this experience close to his heart. Is Rainbow Knight a hero or is he a criminal?

episodes.title: End of the Endless Family
episodes.plot: Minoru was a Japanese prisoner of war to the U.S. and has gone missing for 30 years. His family has survived a disaster at the chemical plant completely unscathed. The Superhuman Bureau investigates this family after rumors of them potentially being immortal.

episodes.title: Mirage of Destiny
episodes.plot: A new organization arises named Infernal Queen, known for their radical methods of killing those they deem evil. The leader bears a strong resemblance to Hyouma, which begs the question: who is Hyouma and are those two the same person?

episodes.title: Justice/Freedom/Peace
episodes.plot: The U.S. navy's submarine, Antares is coming to Japan. At the same time this is happening, the Angel Stars are performing to hundreds of youths, leading to riots. From all of this arises a superhuman named Claude, who attacks the submarine, unraveling secrets.

episodes.title: Hakko Superhuman Crash Incident
episodes.plot: Doctors and nurses have been murdered left and right in Sapporo. Is Claude the perpetrator of these murders and if so, what are his motivations?

episodes.title: Riots in Shinjuku
episodes.plot: Claude gains a following of thousands who are anti-establishment and start rioting in Shinjuku, organizing a "Superhuman Revolution". Will Jiro be able to face off against Claude, and would doing so change anything?
